name: prototypically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is extremely typical of something: She spent her early years in a prototypically quaint Yorkshire village. My father’s relatives have prototypically American taste in food, in contrast to my mother's Greek family.
More examplesFewer examplesThe household was prototypically three or four people living together in one house.The central group represents prototypically co-operative behaviour. In English, adverbs prototypically take an -ly suffix.
